skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

skillTree.localised_description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

skillTree.localised_description: The wild Griffons of Ulthuan are creatures of noble bearing and keen intelligence, with whom Elves form bonds that only death can shatter.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Those who follow the Bringer of Wrath and Fire are blessed with direct and forceful solutions to the obstacles in their way.
As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

skillTree.localised_description: If you can hold you ground when all around are falling into the cracks, then that's the patronage of Hukon, God of Earthquakes.

skillTree.localised_description: These enchanted arrows have been carefully crafted from the pale-wooded trees that grow near the Grove of Avelorn.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves

skillTree.localised_description: Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs single and multiple units
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: There's dull, boring, and inattentive... and there's this live wire.
When this one plans an ambush, every possible option is considered. Nothing is left to chance.
Ever watchful, this one bides their time until precisely the right moment to attack.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -25%
	(enemy characters in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: It's surprising that this one can even lift a pen, let alone a sword.
Always considered, never rushing to judge, all conclusions based on empirical evidence, no conjecture.
The strength at the base of the pillar.
This one couldn't hit an Ogre at ten yards, let alone a ravening pack of Skaven!
This one can hit an Ogre at one hundred yards, and a ravening pack of Skaven at fifty!
You have to get up very early if you want to beat this one; nothing escapes their keen eye and lightning reflexes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Locking themselves out of rooms; that bad batch of oysters; the one stray arrow - this one is more than simply unlucky!
Chance is like magic - it can be harnessed to the individual's will.
There must be runes about their person - no one could be this lucky otherwise!

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

backgroundSkills.localised_description: When their army charges towards the foe, this one can clearly be seen legging it in the opposite direction!
Unswerving and determined, this one is an immovable force on the battlefield.
You can almost see the hearts fluttering when this one passes by, on their way to derring-do and adventure.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Someone less suited to bodily activity it would be hard to find.
Why walk when you can run? Why run when you can fly?
Always animated, this one has an infectious vitality about them.
